text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Dale a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Cape Town
today I'm going to show you how to
receive Amazon simple notification
service notifications for specific
Amazon relational database service for
SQL Server log events that match an
Amazon cloudwatch filter pattern let's
get
started first we must publ the SQL
Server logs to Amazon cloudwatch logs
open the Amazon RS console choose
databases from the navigation pan select
the DB instance that you want to
configure choose the modify button on
the modify DB instance page choose the
erog checkbox under log exports choose
continue at the end of the page choose
apply immediately and then choose modify
DB instance the instance status changes
first to configure log exports and then
available if you don't see that the logs
are published then make sure that you
selected apply immediately earlier after
the logs are published we can create
metric filters navigate to
cloudwatch from the cloudwatch
navigation pan choose logs and then log
groups select the Ed log group for your
Amazon ODS instance choose the actions
drop down list and then create metric
filter for the filter pattern enter
Search terms such as percentage login
failed for user percentage to track
failed
logins note that the pattern is case
sensitive you can test the filter
pattern on existing logs by choosing
test
pattern this T shows you how many log
events match the pattern if you do not
see your logs
confirm that you choose your log under
the drop down list select log data to
test when you see the results that you
expect choose
next enter a name for the fter and
Metric set the metric value to one so
that the metric increments by one for
each matching event set the default
value to zero choose
next choose gr metric filter
select the check box for the metric
filter that we just created choose
create
alarm from the period drop down list
select the evaluation period the default
period is 5 minutes for this video I'll
use the default 5
minutes for conditions leave both
threshold type to static and the
whenever login filed for user is to
Greater then enter a threshold value
valid for your use case for this video
I'll use 10 under additional
configuration set data points to alarm
based on the evaluation periods that you
want to trigger the alarm for I'll use 5
minutes under missing data treatment
choose the option which suits your use
case I'll be using the default treat
missing data as missing choose next on
the notification page either select an
existing SNS topic or create a new one
enter the email address to receive
notifications click on create
topic note for new SNS topics you will
receive an email to confirm the
subscription be sure that you confirm
the subscription review the alarm
details and then choose next enter an
alarm name choose next choose create
alarm the alarm will go into
insufficient data State initially until
there are enough data points if the
metric exceeds the threshold such as
more than 10 failed logins in 5 minutes
you will receive an SNS notification
email and the alarm state will be in
alarm so now you know how to receive
Amazon SNS notifications for specific
Amazon RDS for SQL Server log events
that match a cloudwatch filter
pattern thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
